Because it applies to everything behind the element, to see the effect you must make the element or its background at least partially transparent.", user: { prenom:"Nasser", nom:"Nourou", photo:"https://img-4.linternaute.com/ROUIuiso_K2p5B8_xuA9GZJ41CY=/2610x/smart/41072375ec4f4bae808550106194e814/ccmcms-linternaute/10656232.jpg", displayName:"Nasser Nourou", username:"nan0u_b1nks", dateCreation:"le 3 janvier 2022", points:2352, status:"Morphologie de type B majuscule", resaux:[ { nom:"Instagram", identifiant:"@nanou-B1nks", url:"200 â‚¬" }, { nom:"Tweeter", identifiant:"@nanou-B1nks", url:"Boutique physique et en ligne" }, { nom:"Snapchat", identifiant:"@nanou-B1nks", url:"Soumettre sa tenu avant la date de fin" }, { nom:"TikTok", identifiant:"@nanou-B1nks", url:"Soumettre sa tenu avant la date de fin" }, ], proprietaire:true, } }, ] } ] const changePhoto = (p) =>{ const el = "c"+p.id const index = document.getElementById(el) let i = index.innerHTML let newi = 0 console.log("p",p) if (Number(i)===p.img.length-1){ newi = 0 } else{ newi = Number(i)+1 } index.innerHTML = newi index.parentElement.children[1].src = p.img[newi] } const conseils = conseils_json.map(c =>
{ e.target.parentElement.parentElement.classList.remove("act") }}/>

) return(
{conseils}
) } export default Conseil;
